Text: sounds good thanks, if you have the source would it be possible to bother you for an avi? personally i dont dl ogvs they arent compatible with anything. please and thanks. :)

@metalcore

i'm not a big fan of proprietary formats and try to avoid using them as much as i can.

well, im no expert but doesnt it depend on the codec used? isnt avi just a contaner or wrapper? i always use xvid , as opposed to divx (xvid is open source as far as i know)...and the avi container is MUCH more compatible. though i do use ac3 audio, not sure where that stands. not all of us have super sweet computer set-ups like you may have and prefer to watch it on our standalones, and i dont see the harm done with xvid and avi seeing as they provide superior rips.

thanks for the seed guys
cheers
